results.content:
Pretty low grade and further proof of Udemy's low bar. The course fails both in content as well as in delivery. Experienced software developers will notice that the instructor is a novice himself with a poor foundation in programming basics and is clueless many a time. The instructor struggles to even process JSON. Poor programming is the highlight of this course.  As an experienced developer myself I would recommend staying away from this course.  The course does not meet it's stated objective, you do not develop full stack skills.
With regard to delivery this course makes a mockery of course preparation what with the same lecture repeated in videos, titles not matching content and a lot more shortcomings.
Not least of all, plenty of content is outdated as of writing this comment. Udemy should be ashamed of cheating people of their money.

Instructor : Knowing a couple of frameworks doesn't qualify you. You are sorely lacking in the fundamentals of programming if you understand what I mean. The fact that you are getting defensive proves my point. You might want to learn programming before instructing others.

results.content: the guy does not explain anything at all about what files are being saved or where to open them in the first lesson. you are completely on your own for that and if you're a mac user. guess what, you cant open the "git" file or even find it anywhere on your computer for that matter. hes not telling you how to open anything or where to find it on your own device. now i have wasted a half an hour trying to figure out where git installed and its taking up memory that I probably wont be able to get back because I cant find the program to delete it.
